intro: Bouchea glabrata, commonly known as the smooth bouchea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a velvety texture. Bouchea glabrata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is well adapted to dry, rocky soils.
